sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都可表示"有创造力的"之意。
means: creative ： 侧重指具有把本来不存在的事物创造出来的能力。
original ： 强调具有与众不同，有独到之处的创造能力。
imaginative ： 指想象大异于现实，近乎或等于虚构。强调富有幻想能力。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"新的"之意。
means: new ： 普通用词，与old相对，指最近的或创新的。
fresh ： 指新鲜的、新做的，侧重创新。
novel ： 侧重新事物的新奇和独特。
innovative ： 强调富有创新和革新精神。

sentence.Network_en: The new town would have been unrecognisable to the original inhabitants.
sentence.Network_cn: 原来的居民可能会认不出这个崭新的城镇了。

sentence.Network_en: Any faults in the original cider stood out sharply after distillation.
sentence.Network_cn: 原先苹果酒里的任何杂质在蒸馏后都会凸现出来。

sentence.Network_en: Sometimes the original abortion was done so badly that the uterus prolapsed.
sentence.Network_cn: 有时第一次流产手术做得太糟糕，会导致子宫下垂。

means.word_mean: 创造性的,独立的,不模仿的
最初的,基本的,天生的,特产的
有独创性的人,古怪的人

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (the earliest use being in the phrase original sin): from Old French, or from Latin originalis, from origin- (see origin)

entry.tran: 起初的；最初的；原先的；原来的
entry.def: You use original when referring to something that existed at the beginning of a process or activity, or the characteristics that something had when it began or was made.

example.ex: The original plan was to hold an indefinite stoppage...
example.tran: 最初的计划是无限期停工。

example.ex: The inhabitants have voted overwhelmingly to restore the city's original name of Chemnitz.
example.tran: 居民以压倒多数票同意恢复该市原来的名字“开姆尼茨”。

entry.tran: 原物；原件；原作；原著；原文
entry.def: If something such as a document, a work of art, or a piece of writing is an original, it is not a copy or a later version.

example.ex: When you have filled in the questionnaire, copy it and send the original to your employer...
example.tran: 填好这份问卷后，复印一份并将原卷交给雇主。

example.ex: For once the sequel is as good as the original.
example.tran: 续集破天荒地与第一部一样精彩。

entry.tran: 原物的；原件的；原作的；非复制的
entry.def: An original document or work of art is not a copy.

entry.tran: 新创作的；未发表的；未发行的；未曾演出的
entry.def: An original piece of writing or music was written recently and has not been published or performed before.

example.tran: 其委托创作新作品的政策

example.ex: ...with catchy original songs by Richard Warner.
example.tran: 以及理查德·沃纳最新创作的朗朗上口的歌曲

entry.def: If you describe someone or their work as original, you mean that they are very imaginative and have new ideas.

example.ex: It is one of the most original works of imagination in the language.
example.tran: 这是用该语言写成的最具独创性和想象力的作品之一。

entry.def: If you read or sing something in the original or, for example, in the original French, you read or sing it in the language it was written in, rather than a translation.

example.ex: He read every book or author it deals with, often in the original...
example.tran: 这方面的每一本书和每一位作家他都读过，而且通常均为原著。

example.ex: The texts were sung in the original Italian.
example.tran: 这些歌词是用原来的意大利语演唱的。

means.word_mean: 1. an original creation (i.e., an audio recording) from which copies can be made
2. an original model on which something is patterned
1. preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed;

sentences.sentence: "the book still has its original binding"
"restored the house to its original condition"

means.word_mean: 2. (of e.g. information) not secondhand or by way of something intermediary;

sentences.sentence: "his work is based on only original, not secondary, sources"

means.word_mean: 3. being or productive of something fresh and unusual; or being as first made or thought of;
4. not derived or copied or translated from something else;

sentences.sentence: "the play is original; not an adaptation"
"he kept the original copy and gave her only a xerox"
"the translation misses much of the subtlety of the original French"

stems_affixes.word_buile: origin[n.起源,由来;出身,来历]+al……的→adj.最初的,原文的;新颖的 n.原物,原作,原文
ab加强+origin起源+al……的→起源而来→原始的
original最初的+ly表副词→adv.最初, 原先
orig升起,开始+in→生命开始→起源
origin[n.起源,由来;出身,来历]+al……的→adj.最初的,原文的;新颖的 n.原物,原作,原文
origin起源+ate表动词→v.[in,from]起源,发生;首创,创造
